meanings.definition: Lend (money) that has been borrowed back to someone else.
meanings.sent1: She decided to relend the money to her friend.
meanings.sent2: The bank offers a relending service for those in need.
meanings.sent3: The money was feeling adventurous and wanted to relend itself to different people.
meanings.sent4: Her generosity was like a boomerang, always relending what she had borrowed.
meanings.sent5: The concept of relending can help circulate funds in the community.

meanings.definition: The act of lending money that has been borrowed back to someone else.
meanings.sent1: Relending can be a helpful practice in certain financial situations.
meanings.sent2: The relending process involves careful consideration of interest rates.
meanings.sent3: The relending event at the charity fundraiser was a huge success.
meanings.sent4: The cycle of relending can create a sense of community support.
meanings.sent5: Her job at the bank involved overseeing the relending operations.
